agency: US Digital Service/Department of Government Efficiency
event: Amy Gleason joins the USDS, according to her sworn testimony.
Acting OPM Director Charles Ezell replaces existing CIO Melvin Brown with Greg Hogan
The DOGE team moves into OPM, installing sofa beds and armed security

agency: US Digital Service/Department of Government Efficiency
event: An Inauguration Day executive order renames the US Digital Services and establishes the DOGE Temporary Organization within it, staffed with 4-person teams in agencies for "implementing the president's DOGE agenda"

agency: US Digital Service/Department of Government Efficiency
event: In another executive order, Trump declares a hiring freeze and that DOGE will work with OMB and OPM to submit a plan to reduce the size of the government within 90 days

agency: US Digital Service/Department of Government Efficiency
event: USDS is transferred out of the Office of Management and Budget (OMB) and established a standalone office in the Executive Office of the President

agency: US Digital Service/Department of Government Efficiency
event: USDS/DOGE named as defendant in new lawsuit Public Citizen Inc et al v. Donald J. Trump and Office of Management and Budget (D.D.C.) (Case No 1:25-cv-00164)

agency: US Digital Service/Department of Government Efficiency
event: USDS/DOGE named as defendant in new lawsuit Center for Biological Diversity v. Office of Management and Budget (D.D.C.) (Case No 1:25-cv-00165)
Marko Elez starts at the Treasury Department and is granted full read-write access to systems

agency: US Digital Service/Department of Government Efficiency
event: DOGE staff start screening all USDS staff in interviews, asking them their views of DOGE and who were underperformers who should be fired.
Thomas Krause starts at the Treasury Department
OPM sends out a first test email from its new government-wide email system
Commerce Department Inspector General is fired in a late-night purge
Trump fires the USDA Inspector General in a late-night purge
Trump fires the DoD Inspector General in a late-night purge
Trump fires the Inspector General for the Department of Education in a late-night purge
Trump fires the Inspector General for the Department of Energy in a late-night purge
Trump fires the Inspector General for the Department of Labor in a late-night purge
Treasury Chief of Staff Dan Katz sends an email stating that DOGE staff need to be given access to pause USAID payments
Trump fires the Inspector General for the Department of the Treasury in a late-night purge
Trump fires the EPA Inspector General in a late-night purge
Trump fires the HHS Inspector General in a late-night purge
Trump fires the OPM Inspector General in a late-night purge
Trump fires the SBA Inspector General in a late-night purge
Spurred by rumors there would be a funding freeze, HUD grantees drew their funds early at 5x normal rate or $1.5 billion
OPM sends a second test email from its new government-wide email system to all government employees

A member of the OPM union posts a Reddit message reportedly from an OPM employee stating that the email server is a piece of outside equipment and the goal is to generate lists of all govt employees to send massive firing notices later.
Two anonymous federal employees file a class action lawsuit against OPM for launching the new email system without conducting a Privacy Impact Assessment for the new system
OPM named as defendant in new lawsuit Jane Does 1-2 v. Office of Personnel Management (D.D.C.) (Case No 1:25-cv-00234)
According to his sworn testimony, Adam Ramada started working at the Department of Education on this date. He says there is one other USDS staffer with him, two other detailees and two DOE staffers.
Two DOGE staffers attempted to force water pumps to be turned on in a large reservoir in California for a photo op
OPM sends out the "Fork in the Road" email to all federal employees offering them a chance to resign
Leland Dudek reaches out to Tiffany Flick, the Associate Director of Budget, Facilities and Security to inform her two DOGE staff would be onboarding. He was a mid-level employee at the time.
Federal employees at OPM are locked out of access to key systems by DOGE and OPM leadership
Mike Russo begins onboarding as new CIO, introduces himself as a DOGE representative to staff

Twenty DOGE staff are in the agency and "have gained access to multiple sensitive internal systems, the people said, including a financial aid dataset that contains the personal information for millions of students enrolled in the federal student aid program."
Treasury named as defendant in new lawsuit Alliance for Retired Americans v. Scott Bessent et al (D.D.C.) (Case No 1:25-cv-00313)
Email to SBA staff announces that Edward Coristine was granted access to all systems including HR, contract, and payment systems.
Democrats on the House Committee on Small Business send a letter requesting details on DOGE's operations at SBA
Mike Russo officially joins the agency as its new CIO, requests Akash Bobba to join the agency (but he has issues with his background check)
DOL staff reportedly ordered "to give DOGE access to whatever they ask for—or risk termination"
Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent writes a letter to Congress about Scott Krause having read-only access but doesn't mention Marko Elez
Gauiter "Cole" Killian appears in an EPA internal directory as a "Federal Detailee"
DOGE staff enter NOAA facilities
OPM named as defendant in new lawsuit American Federation of Gov’t Employees, AFL-CIO v. Ezell (D. Mass) (Case No 1:25-cv-10276)

agency: Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services
event: DOGE staff reported with agency buildings with access to certain systems
DOGE staff enters the Commerce Department
Luke Farritor was granted access to the Energy Department's IT system on Wednesday by Energy Secretary Chris Wright over objections from agency security staff
DOGE staff are given access to the Department of Labor IT systems
DOL named as defendant in new lawsuit AFL-CIO v. Dep’t of Labor (D.D.C.) (Case No 1:25-cv-00339)
Elon Musk promises that DOGE will make rapid upgrades to airline systems after outage of NOTAM alerting system
Edward Coristine is given a FEMA badge and onboarded into the agency
NOAA employees were ordered to grant Rajpal editor access to all NOAA Google sites on instructions of the acting commerce secretary, Jeremy Pelter, by the close of business.
OPM attests the government-wide email system runs on agency systems
OPM issues a Privacy Impact Assessment for its Government-Wide Email System (GWES) that states responses are voluntary, brief and do not include identifying information

agency: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
event: DOGE staff arrive at CDC HQ in Atlanta
DOGE staff enter CFPB facilities and are given equipment and onboarded
The Washington Post reports that DOGE is feeding Department of Education data into an AI system hosted in Microsoft Azure
Judge Colleen Kollar-Kotelly rules that DOGE should only be granted read access to government systems
Marko Elez was discovered to inappropriately have read-write access on his laptop
Marko Elez resigns allegedly after past racist tweets are revealed (but also same day as being discovered with write access)
DOGE member and lawyer Jacob Altik joins the case for the defense
The court dismisses the motion for a temporary restraining order against the OPM email system since there is now a PIA
OPM named as defendant in new lawsuit Government Accountability Project v. Office of Personnel Management (D.D.C.) (Case No 1:25-cv-00347)
DOGE staff are granted read-only access to the HR, PRISM, and Discoverer systems
Elon Musk posts a tweet "CFPB RIP" with a tombstone emoji
DOGE staff are given full privileged access to CFPB systems without completing training or agreeing to CFPB's acceptable use policy for IT systems
The CFPB homepage is deleted and returns a 404 error
ED named as defendant in new lawsuit University of California Student Assn. v. Carter et al (Case No 1:25-cv-00354)
Ryan Riedel, a SpaceX network security engineer with 4 years of experience, is named the CIO for the agency
Sources indicate that 3 unidentified DOGE personnel are working at the Department of Energy
Treasury named as defendant in new lawsuit New York et al v. Donald J. Trump (S.D.N.Y.) (Case No 1:25-cv-01144-JAV)
168 employees who worked on environmental justice are placed on indefinite administrative leave
A lawsuit filed by multiple labor organization (and others) alleged that DOGE wants to access whistleblower information at OSHA
NBC News reports that Akash Bobba and Ethan Shaotran have admin access to email and had also accessed the website backend
DOGE social media account on X boasts about deleting a DHS page of LGBTQI+ resources
CFPB named as defendant in new lawsuit National Treasury Employees Union v. Russell Vought (D.D.C.) (Case No 1:25-cv-00380)
CFPB named as defendant in new lawsuit National Treasury Employees Union v. Russell Vought (D.D.C.) (Case No 1:25-cv-00381)
ED named as defendant in new lawsuit American Federation of Teachers et al v. Bessent et al (D. Md.) (Case No 8:25-cv-00430)
Edward Coristine appears in a DHS directory as a "senior advisor"
Affadavit states a BFS payment was presented to State Department to not process after review by DOGE
Treasury named as defendant in new lawsuit American Federation of Teachers et al v. Bessent et al (D. Md.) (Case No 8:25-cv-00430)
NOTAM has its name changed from Notice to Air Missions back to its original name of Notice to Airmen
Employees at HUD receive an email from Scott Langmack asking them to list every contract at HUD and whether it is critical and/or has DEI components
OPM named as defendant in new lawsuit American Federation of Teachers et al v. Bessent et al (D. Md.) (Case No 8:25-cv-00430)
OPM named as defendant in new lawsuit Electronic Privacy Information Center v. U.S. Office of Personnel Management (E.D.V.A.) (Case No 1:25-cv-00255)
Mike Russo, DOGE chief of staff Steve Davis both demand that Akash Bobba be onboarded before midnight.
CIO Mike Russo convenes his own internal informational group in SSA, has conversations with other agencies about data sharing, does not inform acting SSA Director, Michelle King
Akash Bobba is rapidly trained and is granted access to anonymized and read-only "sandbox" NUMIDENT data for his purported fraud investigations
Edward Coristine and Luke Farritor are posted to the State Department's Bureau of Diplomatic Technology
CFPB Contracting Officers (COs) are ordered to terminate the vast majority of CFPB's contracts during that weekend
Department of Education agreed to block DOGE from access to financial aid systems
Affadavit states Marko Elez was accidentally given edit access to BFS systems but did not use it
The CFO of FEMA, Mary Comans, was fired and her departure was announced in a press release
OPM named as defendant in new lawsuit American Federation of Government Employees, et al. v. Office of Personnel Management et al (S.D.N.Y) (Case No 1:25-cv-01237)
OPM named as defendant in new lawsuit Nemeth-Greenleaf, et al. v. Office of Personnel Management, et al. (D.D.C.) (Case No 1:25-cv-00407)

agency: US Digital Service/Department of Government Efficiency
event: Trump issues an executive order giving DOGE teams in every agency final approval on any hiring decisions, sets quota of 1 new hire for 4 departures

agency: US Digital Service/Department of Government Efficiency
event: USDS/DOGE named as defendant in new lawsuit American Oversight v. Department of Government Efficiency (D.D.C.) (Case No 1:25-cv-00409)
Adam Martinez, CFPB COO, includes DOGE representatives in emails hiring OPM for consulting on Reduction-in-Force planning for the CFPB
Treasury named as defendant in new lawsuit Gribbon et al. v. Musk (D.D.C.) (Case No 1:25-cv-00422)
Dozens of workers within the Technology Transformation Service (TTS) are fired.
OPM named as defendant in new lawsuit Gribbon et al. v. Musk (D.D.C.) (Case No 1:25-cv-00422)

agency: US Digital Service/Department of Government Efficiency
event: USDS/DOGE named as defendant in new lawsuit Gribbon et al. v. Musk (D.D.C.) (Case No 1:25-cv-00422)
Jordan Wick demands for mass termination notices to be sent to CFPB employees by February 14
DOGE is granted authorization to use file transfer software
Gavin Kliger arrives at the IRS to begin onboarding

According to a sworn declaration by a Deputy Commissioner at SSA, an unindentified DOGE staffer (Employee 1) is onboarded for "duties currently relate to improper payments and SSA's Death Master File" and they are also planning to detail him to the Small Business Administration

agency: US Digital Service/Department of Government Efficiency
event: DOGE announces its website is now live with an organizational chart and tweets

agency: US Digital Service/Department of Government Efficiency
event: USDS/DOGE named as defendant in new lawsuit J. Doe 1-26 v. Musk (D. Md) (Case No 8:25-cv-00462-TDC)

agency: US Digital Service/Department of Government Efficiency
event: USDS/DOGE named as defendant in new lawsuit New Mexico et al v. Musk (D.D.C.) (Case No 1.25-cv-00429)
The CFPB's social media accounts are deleted and videos are removed from its YouTube channel
In a speech, Secretary of Agriculture says DOGE has been at the agency for "a few weeks"

After a conservative account complained to Musk on Twitter about gender options on the FAFSA form, it was changed the same day (a change was planned, but multiple contractors were called in to rush it)
388 probabtionary employees are fired
NASA administrator emails all staff to report that "DOGE has arrived"

agency: National Institute of Standards and Technology
event: NIST workers witness a handful people they suspect of being DOGE at NIST IT facilities in Gaithersburg, MD
Leland Dudek is placed on administrative leave while under investigation that he committed inappropriate actions to help DOGE
USDA accidentally includes official working on H5N1 response in mass firings of probationary employees

Akash Bobba reports issue with the "sandbox" data. Russo demands he gets immediate full access to Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW), Master Beneficiary Record (MBR) and Supplemental Security Record (SSR) files as well as source code
Staff express concern to Acting Commissioner King that Bobba is accessing information remotely and in an insecure location (the OPM)
4 SpaceX engineers were onboarded into the FAA under the Schedule A hiring authority for people with disabilities
White House pressures the IRS to sign a MOU granting DOGE expanded access to internal systems
The acting director of the Social Security Administration, Michelle King, receives an email from the White House that Dudek is now the Acting Commissioner.

agency: US Digital Service/Department of Government Efficiency
event: Approximately 50 USDS staff are fired as part (removing approximately 1/3 of the USDS staff that predated DOGE)
The SpaceX engineers are granted ethics waivers and designated as Special Government Employees, but must recuse from decisions affecting SpaceX
The head of the medical device safety division is fired amid mass layoffs
The head of the agency's food safety division resigns because of 89 employees being indiscriminately fired
White House official confirms one DOGE staffer will be working with an IRS employee to access IRS systems
IRS named as defendant in new lawsuit Center for Taxpayer Rights v. IRS (D.D.C) (Case No 1:25-cv-00457)
District Judge Randolph Moss dismisses the suit on the grounds that defendants lack standing or face irreparable injury"
SEC staff report the imminent arrival of DOGE to to the agency

agency: US Digital Service/Department of Government Efficiency
event: In a filing in "State of New Mexico v. Elon Musk," DOJ lawyers declare that Elon Musk is not the USDS Administrator, but just an advisor
An employee requests to repair the CFPB homepage deleted by DOGE, but that action is refused by order of Vought
Unidentified DOGE team has a kickoff meeting with DoD staff at the Pentagon
DoD agencies are ordered to provide lists of probationary employees to DOGE
A federal judge denied an attempt to block DOGE from accessing Department of Education systems related to financial aid
Malaska declares that SpaceX is the only company able to complete a communications network contract already awarded to Verizon, threatens to report anybody blocking his work to Musk
A GSA employee resigned rather than give unrestricted admin access of Notify.gov to Thomas Shedd
Privacy advocates sue to stop DOGE acess to IRS systems
CNN reporter shares that a FOIA request about DOGE was replied to with "they just fired the whole privacy team"

According to a sworn declaration by a Deputy Commissioner at SSA, "we began onboarding and training Employee 3, a Schedule C Policy Advisor, detailed from the Department of Labor to SSA" with it finalized on February 22. "His duties currently relate to improper payments and SSA’s Death Master File."
According to a sworn declaration, "SSA began onboarding and training Employee 5, an engineer, detailed from the United States DOGE Service to SSA" with an inter-agency agreement to DOGE.

According to a sworn declaration, SSA "began onboarding and training Employee 2, Senior Advisor (Program Specialist AD-0301-00). He is in the process of being detailed from National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) to SSA."

agency: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
event: Staff at the CDC CIO's office report not being contacted by DOGE yet
Edward Coristine and Kyle Schutt are given access to CISA systems
Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent says only one person from DOGE is "looking at an outdated IT system, that's all they're doing."
Thomas Shedd has allegedly requested admin access to 19 different systems within TTS at GSA

According to one agency employee, DOGE workers already have access to contracts, partnerships, performance reviews, classified national-security information, and satellite data, among other materials.
According to a sworn declaration, "Employee 10, a software engineer, was detailed from the Office of the Administrator at the General Services Administration to SSA" (possibly Ehtan Shaotran)
USADF board member Ward Brehm becomes aware that his agency is going to be targeted by DOGE for elimination

agency: US Digital Service/Department of Government Efficiency
event: Trump issues an Executive Order "Commencing the Reduction of the Federal Bureaucracy" targeting the Presidio Trust, the Inter-American Foundation, the United States African Development Foundation and the United States Institute of Peace for reductions.
Division leaders at the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency informed some senior CISA staffers that DOGE has access to internal emails and Microsoft Teams chats of employees.
Defense Secretary Hegseth releases a video stating that he met with DOGE about cuts to the agency and many of them are veterans
John York, a senior counselor to Bessent, wrote in a sworn statement that Ryan Wunderly would take over Marko Elez's work at the BFS
DOGE staff gains access to the HUD Enforcement Management System (HEMS), which contains information on victims of housing discrimination and domestic violence
DOGE staff arrived at IAF HQ and were granted access to IT systems, as reported by IAF CEO Sara Aviel the following day
The White House and Treasury Department come to an agreement about how DOGE access to IRS systems will be structured
In a court filing, Treasury says it is adding two more DOGE staffers focused on the IRS
Several DOGE staffers at the agency are identified by Social Security Works (a nonprofit advocacy group) as also working at SSA
Chris Young meets with USADF leadership at their HQ to "introduce DOGE to the agency" and that 2 engineers would be assigned there
USDA Secretary Rollins posts a photo of a grant-cancellation session with @DOGE_USDA
IAF CEO Sara Aviel confirms to a friend at USADF that DOGE plans to dismantle the agency
The Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) between the IRS and DOGE is signed, will not let DOGE access individual tax returns
SSA named as defendant in new lawsuit American Federation of State, County and Municipal Employees, AFL-CIO v. Social Security Administration (D. Md.) (Case No 1:25-cv-00596)
Ethan Shaotran, Jacob Altik, and Nate Cavanaugh arrive at the agency and demand that a MOU must be signed for their detail assignment
The MOU for DOGE's IT Modernization is between USADF and GSA and only covers the activities of Ethan Shaotran
Once MOU is signed, DOGE staff reveal their real purpose is to conduct a massive reduction in agency staff and scope and demand to file a RIF plan by 2/24

Nate Canaugh and Jacob Altik then demanded immediate access to USADF systems including financial records and payment and human resources systems. They were told they had to go through standard clearance process.
Jacob Altik demands waivers to exempt DOGE staff from background checks, threatens to fire USADF board if demands are not materials.
USADF general cousel revokes their participation in the MOU based on it being under false pretenses

agency: US Digital Service/Department of Government Efficiency
event: USDS/DOGE named as defendant in new lawsuit Project on Government Oversight, Inc. v. Trump (D.D.C) (Case No 1:25-cv-00527)
Sara Aviel is dismissed as the CEO of the IAF

In a ruling, a judge declared "DOGE affiliates have been granted access to systems of record that contain some of the plaintiffs’ most sensitive data — Social Security numbers, dates of birth, home addresses, income and assets, citizenship status, and disability status — and their access to this trove of personal information is ongoing"
A court ruling names the systems NSLDS, COD, FAS and FMS as being accessed by DOGE

Reports that DOGE have accounts are working with the NIH Business System Department for NIH’s central electronic business system, which includes finance, budget, procurement, a property-management system, and a grant-tracking system

After Elon Musk threatens on X that employees must complete a list of 5 accomplishments and send it to OPM or risk termination, OPM sends out an email requesting that list (without the threat) to every government employee. Widespread confusion occurs at many agenices.
USADF president/CEO Ward Brehm receives an email from Trent Morse in the White House Personnel Office notifying him that he is removed from tbe board.

agency: US Digital Service/Department of Government Efficiency
event: In a hearing for "Alliance for Retired Americans v. Bessent," Judge Kollar-Kotelly repeatedly grills DOJ lawyers on who the USDS Administrator is
GSA reportedly spending $25,000 to install a washer and dryer near a makeshift sleeping area occupied by DOGE
The Post reports that DOGE is being granted access to only anonymized data from IDRS
DOGE engineer Ricardo Biasini is reported to be working on updating software to automate Reduction-in-Force (RIF) processes

agency: US Digital Service/Department of Government Efficiency
event: 21 remaining USDS staff publicly resign in protest of DOGE's actions

agency: US Digital Service/Department of Government Efficiency
event: DOGE announces they have launched the feature on their website showing contract cancellations (many of these savings are later shown to be wildly erroneous)
Republican lawmakers on the U.S. House Committee on Homeland Security unanimously opposed a resolution of inquiry into DOGE activities at DHS

Wired reports that DOGE staff were given read-only access to some systems and read-write access to payment systems within HUD as well as the centralized authorization system that grants access to other systems (date unknown)
According to a sworn declaration, "employee 8, an engineer, was detailed from Office of Personnel Management to SSA. His duties currently relate to improper payments and death data."

agency: US Digital Service/Department of Government Efficiency
event: Trump issues an executive order mandating that DOGE teams will have approval over awarding any contract at any agency and freezes purchase cards for 90 days

agency: US Digital Service/Department of Government Efficiency
event: After days of sustained questioning about who the USDS Administrator is, the White House gives the name of Amy Gleason. It is unclear how long she had been in the role.
Thomas Shedd, an engineer who has worked 8 years at Tesla, is named the head of GSA's Technology Transformation Services (TTS)
According to a sworn declaration, "Employees 4, 6, and 9 were each appointed as an expert, special government employee"

agency: US Digital Service/Department of Government Efficiency
event: U.S. District Judge John Bates orders that some DOGE officials should be required to testify under oath
Peter Marocco arrives at IAF after most staff had left, holds an impromptu board meeting with himself only, declares himself President/CEO of IAF

Gavin Kliger and Sam Corcos, DOGE representatives embedded at the tax agency, on Friday asked IRS lawyers to assist in creating an “omnibus” agreement with other federal agencies that would allow a broad swath of federal officials to cross-reference benefits rolls with taxpayer data
OPM amends the Privacy Impact Assessment for its Government-Wide Email System (GWES) to remove declarations that responses are voluntary.

USADF Managing Director of Finance Mathieu Zahui receives an email from Trent Morse informing him the USADF is "boardless" and naming Peter Marocco as acting chair. Zahui informs them appointment would require senate confirmation first.
TTS administrator Thomas Shedd eliminates 90 members of 18F with a 1am firing email and locks them out of their machines
Hours after the staff is hit with the RIF email, the DNS entry for 18F.gsa.gov is removed
All government employees receive a second email telling them they must list their accomplishments every Monday by 11:59pm
In an email to staff, Dudek explains the disruptions by saying "elections have consequences"
DOI named as defendant in new lawsuit Center for Biological Diversity v. U.S. Department of Interior (D.D.C.) (Case No 1:25-cv-00612)

DOGE staff attempt to access "a system within a broader government database created to help enforce child support payments, which pulls a vast trove of information, including income data linked to nearly all workers"
The head of HR, Traci DiMartini, is placed on administrative leave for refusing to bring in employees over the weekend to onboard Sam Corcos
USADF board member Ward Brehm is elected by the board as President/CEO of USADF
DOGE boasts in a tweet that 27% more water was released in February compared to January (unclear if this adjusts for different lengths of months)
FEMA named as defendant in new lawsuit Comans v. Department of Homeland Security (D.D.C.) (Case No 1:25-cv-00624)
Wired reports that some DOGE staff (Kyle Schutt, Nate Cavanaugh) are being paid in the GSA, but others are listed as volunteers for that agency
Amy Gleason (purported head of DOGE) is formally onboarded at HHS as a Senior Advisor and swears the oath of office
Brad Smith is formally onboarded at HHS as a Senior Advisor and swears the oath of office
Peter Marocco announces himself to staff as President/CEO, begins dismantling all contracts, places all staff on administrative leave for 30 days
DOGE brags on its X account that the IAF has been reduced to a single employee

In a meeting, Dudek stresses again that DOGE will make mistakes and also admits "I am receiving decisions that are made without my input. I have to effectuate those decisions," suggesting DOGE is in charge.
USADF CFO Mathieu Zahui receives an email from Nate Cavanaugh informing him that Peter Marocco would be coming to the office the following day as Chairman of the Board
Jordan Wick is formally onboarded as an employee of the CFPB (and not a DOGE detailee) and swears the Oath of Office
Business Insider reports Marko Elez, Aram Moghaddassi, and Miles B. Collins are new DOGE arrivals at Department of Labor
According to a sworn declaration, "the agency began onboarding Employee 7, as a detailee from Department of Labor (DOL) to SSA."
Nate Cavanaugh sends Ward Brehm an email demanding to know by what authority he is the President/CFO of USADF
Jacob Altik and Ethan Shaotran are rebuffed by agency leadership when attempting to enter the agency

agency: US Digital Service/Department of Government Efficiency
event: From this date, detailing arrangements for DOGE staff are between the target agency and other agencies hiring DOGE staff, according to a declaration made by DOGE in AFL-CIO et al vs. Department of Labor

agency: US Digital Service/Department of Government Efficiency
event: USDS/DOGE named as defendant in new lawsuit Japanese American Citizens League v. Musk (D.D.C.) (Case No 1:25-cv-00643)
Thomas Shedd says in a statement that he expects TTS will be 50% smaller within weeks
DOGE staff Jacob Altik and Ethan Shaotran return joined by Nate Cavanaugh with US marshals to force entry to the agency
ED named as defendant in new lawsuit Democracy Forward Foundation v. U.S. Department of the Treasury (D.D.C.) (Case No 1:25-cv-00684)
Treasury named as defendant in new lawsuit Centro de Trabajadores Unidos v. Bessent (D.D.C) (Case No 1:25-cv-00677)
Treasury named as defendant in new lawsuit Democracy Forward Foundation v. U.S. Department of the Treasury (D.D.C.) (Case No 1:25-cv-00684)
DOGE rolls out a custom GSAi custom chatbot to 1500 workers
SBA named as defendant in new lawsuit Democracy Forward Foundation v. U.S. Department of the Treasury (D.D.C.) (Case No 1:25-cv-00684)
DOGE staff are granted access to NDNH and objecting federal staff are "no longer with the agency"
The Trump Administration nominates Kenneth Jackson and Russell Vought to be on the board of the IAF
Trump admin nominates Laken Rapier and Russell Vought to be on the board of the USADF

agency: US Digital Service/Department of Government Efficiency
event: U.S. District Judge Christopher Cooper demands a rolling production of DOGE to produce documents in discovery within weeks
New CIO Antoine McCord arrives at DHS, reportedly with affiliates of DOGE
Elon Musk visits the NSA to meet with its top administrator, General Timothy Haugh

In a sworn declaration, Florence Felix-Lawson notes "the SSA DOGE Team currently consists of ten SSA employees: four SSA special government employees (Employees 1, 4, 6, and 9) and six detailees to SSA from other government agencies and offices (Employees 2, 3, 5, 7, 8, and 10)"
Multiple SSA employees told ProPublica, their tech systems seem to be crashing nearly every day, leading to more delays in serving beneficiaries.

agency: US Digital Service/Department of Government Efficiency
event: US District Judge Tanya Chutkan issues an order giving DOGE and Elon Musk three weeks to comply with document discovery requests about its staffing and downsizing plans for agencies
ED named as defendant in new lawsuit State of New York v. McMahon (D.Mass) (Case No 1:25-cv-10601)

As later reported in a declaration in AFL-CIO et al. vs. Department of Labor, HHS employee Mark Samburg finds DOGE staff at the agency listed in an online directory as Executive Engineers (and Rachel Riley as a Senior Advisor)
The acting chief counsel of the IRS, William Paul, is removed from his role and replaced by Andrew De Mello, who is seen as more supportive of DOGE's work at the agency

Wired reports that 10 DOGE staffer – Akash Bobba, Scott Coulter, Marko Elez, Luke Farritor, Antonio Gracias, Gautier Cole Killian, Jon Koval, Nikhil Rajpal, Payton Rehling, and Ethan Shaotran – are showing up in the Microsoft Teams directory at SSA
ProPublica reports Connor Fennessy is active at the Department of Education as a Senior Advisor
ProPublica reports that Scott Coulter has "wide access to internal databases at NASA"
A Business Insider article reports that Alexander Simonpour has shown up at NASA and also has a GSA address. Riley Sennott and Scott Coulter also are listed

A lawyer for the plaintiffs accuses the DOJ of misrepresenting Altik's participation "perhaps to preserve the illusion that OPM’s counsel were ignorant of what OPM was doing with the Government-Wide Email System, or perhaps to obscure the role of DOGE and the White House in this case."

agency: US Digital Service/Department of Government Efficiency
event: In a ruling in J. Doe 1-26 v. Musk (D. Md), Judge Theodore D. Chuang declares that evidence shows that Elon Musk was effectively running DOGE without being appointed to the role
